title: Full-Stack DeveloperFull-Stack Developer
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  üîπ Position: Full-Stack Developerüìç Location: BangaloreüöÄ About UsAt EMO Energy, we‚Äôre a fast-moving deep-tech startup revolutionizing the electric mobility space. We are building a complete end-to-end EV technology stack from high-performance battery systems to intelligent control electronics powering the next generation of electric vehicles. We thrive on innovation, speed, and real-world impact, building products from the ground up. If you want to build, scale, and own products that change how the world moves, this is your stage.‚ö° Job SummaryWe‚Äôre looking for a passionate Full-Stack Developer (Intern or Entry Level: 0‚Äì2 years) who can work with minimal guidance. You will primarily focus on front-end development while also contributing to back-end functionalities. Your role will involve building, maintaining, and improving both web applications and supporting backend systems.üéØ What You Will Do      Design, develop, and optimize responsive, user-friendly front-end interfaces using modern web technologies (React, Angular, Tailwind, Vue.js).Collaborate with designers, product managers, and engineering teams to understand requirements and deliver intuitive UI/UX.Implement interactive, modular, and reusable UI components ensuring consistency across devices and platforms.Optimize front-end performance for speed, scalability, and responsiveness.Work with back-end technologies (Express.js, Node.js, Python) to integrate APIs and support full-stack functionality.Assist in building and maintaining backend services, databases, and API endpoints as needed.Debug and troubleshoot both front-end and basic back-end issues, identifying root causes and implementing fixes.Maintain clean, well-documented, and structured code with clear project documentation and tech guides.Take ownership of tasks and modules, handling them with minimal supervision.Continuously learn and stay updated with the latest trends, tools, and best practices in full-stack development.Support ongoing maintenance and enhancement of internal tools, dashboards, apps, and website features.
‚úÖ What We‚Äôre Looking For      Currently pursuing or completed a Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related fields.Proficiency in front-end technologies (HTML5, CSS3, Tailwind, JavaScript) and at least one major framework (React, Angular, or Vue.js).Basic working knowledge of back-end technologies (Express.js, Python) and RESTful API integration.Understanding of databases (MongoDB/MySQL) and basic schema concepts.Familiarity with Git and collaborative workflows and Strong debugging, analytical, and problem-solving skills.Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as collaborate effectively in a team environment.Eagerness to learn, adapt quickly, and take ownership of tasks in a fast-paced startup setting.
üí° Why Join Us?      Be at the forefront of EV innovation, building technology that drives the future of mobility.Opportunity to own and lead modules end-to-end from idea to deployment.Fast-paced environment with immense learning and growth potential.Work with a world-class team of engineers, innovators, and problem-solvers.Competitive compensation with equity opportunities that grow as we grow.
Skills: javascrip,cloud applications,daabases,frontend development,git,express.js,backend development,html,tailwind,typescript,angular,cgp,mongodb,css,mysql

title: AI Engineer (Agentic Systems & Full Stack)AI Engineer (Agentic Systems & Full Stack)
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  About Cerina HealthCerina Health is a digital mental health company revolutionizing how mental healthcare is designed and delivered. We are moving beyond simple chatbots to build a proprietary Agentic AI Platform.Our mission is to solve the global mental health access crisis by building AI that is fundamentally safe. We use multi-agent architectures to design, simulate, and validate therapeutic protocols under strict clinical governance. We are combining the speed of Generative AI with the safety rigor of medical devices.We are a small, expert team working directly with leading clinical academics and experienced founders in a flat, high-trust environment.The RoleWe are looking for a high-velocity AI Engineer who lives at the intersection of modern full stack software development and Agentic AI.In this role, you will be instrumental in engineering the orchestration layer that manages multiple AI agents (Designers, Critics, Safety Supervisors) and building the interfaces that allow clinicians to interact with them. You will work on "Safety-by-Design" Agentic AI‚Äîone of the most critical and unsolved challenges in the industry.We value engineers who are highly adaptable, fast learners, and who embrace AI-assisted development tools (like Cursor, Claude Code etc.) to amplify their output and solve complex problems at speed.Key Responsibilities      Agentic Orchestration: Design and implement complex, stateful multi-agent workflows using LangGraph and LangChain. Build the logic for agents that propose content, check it against safety rules, and refine it autonomously.Frontend Development: Build sophisticated, responsive applications that visualise agentic workflows, allowing human experts to review, edit, and approve AI-generated clinical protocols.Safety Implementation: Implement "Supervisory Agents" that strictly enforce clinical boundaries to ensure safety and clinical fidelity.System Optimization: Work on optimizing the latency of agentic loops to enable real-time stress testing and simulation of therapeutic conversations.Rapid Prototyping: Use AI-assisted coding tools to rapidly prototype, debug, and iterate on new features.
Requirements1) Technical Skills:      Frontend Capable: Proficiency in TypeScript and modern UI development. While React & React Native is our preferred stack, we are open to engineers strong in other frameworks (Vue, Svelte) or those willing to learn React & React Native quickly. You must be able to build functional UIs to visualize agent workflows.AI Frameworks: Deep hands-on experience with Python, LangChain, and critically, LangGraph. You understand stateful, cyclic agentic graphs (beyond simple RAG chains).Architecture: Solid understanding of event-driven architectures, state machines, and asynchronous processing.
2) Soft Skills & Attributes:      AI-Augmented Workflow: You are proficient in using AI coding assistants (e.g., Cursor, Claude Code, GitHub Copilot) to accelerate development and explore new libraries.Fast Learner: You have a track record of rapidly picking up new tools and frameworks as they emerge. You thrive on "figuring it out."Problem Solver: You approach complex technical challenges with creativity and autonomy.
3) Nice to Have:      Experience in Digital Health, MedTech, or highly regulated industries.Familiarity with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, etc.).Experience with cloud infrastructure (GCP/AWS) and serverless deployment.
Why Join Us?      Work on the Frontier: Build cutting-edge Agentic AI systems that push the boundaries of what is possible in healthcare.Real Impact: Your code will directly contribute to making mental healthcare safer and more accessible for thousands of people.Remote & Flexible: We care about output and problem-solving, not hours in a chair.
Our Recruitment ProcessWe do not believe in broken recruitment practices like whiteboard coding or algorithmic quizzes. We believe the only way to evaluate an engineer is to see them build.      Application: You submit the form below.The Protocol Sprint: If shortlisted, you will receive a 72-hour architectural challenge (designed to be completed over a weekend). You will build a complex Agentic System using the AI tools of your choice.The Review: We review your code and Loom video.Final Interview: We discuss your architecture and make an offer.
How to ApplyTo apply, please complete the form below:- https://forms.gle/Jw37vA1fB3KjFuAw9

title: Linux Software EngineerLinux Software Engineer
description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Linux Software Engineer in Americas, APAC, and EMEA.This role provides an exciting opportunity to work on the forefront of Linux software development, optimizing Ubuntu for next-generation silicon and emerging technologies. You will collaborate with a globally distributed engineering team to enable high-performance computing, AI workloads, IoT devices, and cloud infrastructure. The position involves working across the full Linux stack, contributing to open-source projects, and ensuring seamless integration of software with cutting-edge hardware. This is a chance to influence platform development, drive innovation in open-source ecosystems, and collaborate with both upstream communities and commercial partners. Candidates will engage in both hands-on engineering and strategic technical problem solving in a fast-paced, global environment.      Accountabilities:Collaborate within a distributed team to optimize Linux and Ubuntu for new silicon architectures (x86, ARM, RISC-V, PowerPC, s390x).Develop, maintain, and debug software across servers, HPC systems, AI stacks, IoT devices, and other hardware platforms.Contribute to graphics, audio, multimedia, virtualization, containerization, and hardware enablement stacks.Work with upstream open-source projects, Ubuntu/Debian communities, and commercial customers to ensure high-quality software integration.Maintain package management, dependency resolution, and platform security including secure boot and confidential computing.Participate in code reviews and uphold software quality standards.Travel 2‚Äì4 weeks per year for internal events while working primarily remotely.Requirements:Strong proficiency in C, C++, and Python programming.Experience or interest in Linux distribution packaging and open-source maintenance.Understanding of package management, dependency resolution, and software licensing.Exceptional academic track record or equivalent technical experience.Curiosity, flexibility, and strong collaboration skills in a globally distributed environment.Ability to work with diverse internal and external teams, and communicate effectively.Additional knowledge or experience with:Virtualization and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)Hardware enablement, GPUs, SmartNICs, storage, and sensorsGraphics, audio, multimedia stacksNetworking protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP/REST)IoT and embedded systems, firmware, bootloaders, and operating systemsPerformance optimization and toolchain maintenanceBenefits:Competitive, globally benchmarked compensation, reviewed annually.Remote-first work environment with twice-yearly in-person team sprints.Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year.Annual performance-driven bonus and recognition rewards.Annual holiday leave and maternity/paternity leave.Team Member Assistance Program and wellness platform access.Opportunities for international travel to meet colleagues and attend events.Priority Pass and travel upgrades for company events.
Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.üîç Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.üìä It compares your profile to the job‚Äôs core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.üéØ Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the three candidates with the highest match to the role.üß† When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias ‚Äî focusing solely on your fit for the role. Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or additional assessments) are then made by their internal hiring team.Thank you for your interest!We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Role Description This is a full-time remote role for a Front-End Developer at a growing US based company. The Front End Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing advanced features for web and mobile applications. Qualifications       2-3 years of professional experience working with front-end technologies such as JavaScript, React.js, React Native, or Ruby on Rails.Proficiency in Python and modern web technologies.Experience with performance optimization, offline storage, and multithreading techniques.A bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.Strong ability to collaborate and communicate effectively in a remote team setting.Passionate about delivering high-quality, user-friendly applications.
 Responsibilities       Design, develop, and implement advanced features for dynamic web and mobile applications.Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend engineers to launch new features and improve existing platforms.Integrate APIs and external data sources for seamless functionality.Troubleshoot, identify, and resolve performance bottlenecks and bugs, ensuring exceptional application performance and user experience.Stay up-to-date with the latest front-end technologies and apply innovative solutions to improve development processes.Ensure that applications are responsive, high-quality, and optimized for speed and scalability.
 Compensation$2,000 - $6,000 per month, paid in USD depending on experience.Details       Independent contractor agreement paid 2x monthly.Client has a desire for long term commitment.

About the job
            

            
                
                  Job Title: Full Stack Developer.Location: Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Trichy.Department: Engineering.Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time.Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.Experience: 1-3 years‚Äô experience required.Company:Gnapi Technologies., is an Information Technology Company with registered offices in Canada, United States and India. title: Full Stack EngineerFull Stack Engineer
description:
About the job
            

                  
      
    

  
      This job is sourced from a job board.
      Learn More
  

            
                
                  We are looking for a passionate Full Stack Developer with hands-on experience in React (frontend) and Node.js or Python (backend), along with a strong foundation in AWS cloud services. The ideal candidate will be responsible for building scalable, high-performance web applications and APIs that power critical business functions.Responsibilities      Design, develop, and maintain end-to-end web applications using React and Node.js/Python.Build and integrate RESTful and GraphQL APIs for frontend-backend communication.Develop reusable UI components and ensure responsive, intuitive interfaces.Work with AWS services such as Lambda, API Gateway, S3, DynamoDB, ECS/EKS, CloudFormation, and RDS.Implement CI/CD pipelines (CodePipeline, Jenkins, or GitHub Actions).Optimize application performance, scalability, and reliability.Collaborate with DevOps, Data, and Product teams to define and deliver solutions.Write clean, testable, and maintainable code with good documentation.Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and architecture discussions.
Requirements      Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Frontend      React.js, Redux / Context API, React Hooks.TypeScript or JavaScript (ES6+).HTML5, CSS3, Tailwind / Material UI.Webpack / Vite.
Backend (any One Or Both)      Node.js (Express / NestJS).Python (FastAPI / Flask / Django).RESTful API design, Authentication (OAuth2/JWT).
Database      SQL (PostgreSQL / MySQL).NoSQL (MongoDB / DynamoDB).
Cloud And DevOps      AWS (S3, Lambda, EC2, ECS, CloudWatch, RDS, CloudFormation).Docker and containerization.CI/CD (AWS CodePipeline / Jenkins / GitHub Actions).
Others      Git, Bitbucket, or GitHub.Unit and integration testing (Jest / PyTest / Mocha / Cypress).Familiarity with microservices and event-driven architecture.
Good To Have      Experience with Serverless applications (AWS Lambda + API Gateway).Exposure to AI/ML APIs or Generative AI integration.Knowledge of Terraform or AWS CDK.Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum / Kanban).
This job was posted by Chetna Joshi from UsefulBI.
                
                
                Desired Skills and Experience
                
                  AWS,Angular,Express.js,JavaScript,MongoDB,Node.js,Python,React.js
